intro: Monechma australe, commonly known as the Australian white heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are evergreen, providing year-round structure. Monechma australe is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting native wildlife.
